author: Tony Woolf
comment: The skip features are good.  Unfortunately it cannot organise files by folder, you have to assign everything to a playlist.  This makes it very hard to deal with large numbers of small files used in language learning, so I'm not going to get the paid app.

author: Farkas Gabor
comment: Thank you for the demo! Now I'm sure I'm not gonna buy the full version. It wouldn't be that bad. The GUI is a bit chaotic, and it cannot be used for Android Wear as a standalone music player. These are the biggest faults.

author: Alex Marszalowicz
comment: It's a nice looking player with decent controls. But unless I missed it, there's no way to browse the underlying directory structure for your music. When trying to load something specifically, I could only search by how the file was tagged or browse the whole list.  As someone who was hoping to use this for podcasts (because of the 5/30/60 second skip option) this is a a fatal issue. I'm not keen on flipping through my entire library to find a podcast that may or may not have been tagged correctly.  (And even just for music, I'm not sure all of my mp3s are tagged properly either.) With the default player it's easy - I put all my podcasts in the same place. But that has lousy skip controls.  So I'm trying AstroPlayer now.

reply.author: Hedami
reply.content: You are correct that the app's browsing and searching is tag-based. Folder-based browsing may be added in the future, but for now this is not the app for you if you rely on browsing by folders.

title: Ignores directories, fatal flaw

author: BewitchedFae
comment: In the description it says that only some features won't work if your music is on an SD card , It should read it doesn't work at all if you have  4.4 or later if your music is on your external SD, I'm on a galaxy tablet . Can't give it any rating , but the play store obligates you to give one. Play store also reads it is compatible with my tablet. Uninstalling it of course.

reply.author: Hedami
reply.content: If you can email me the specific error/issue you're having, I can assist you (email link in the Play Store listing).  I have a Galaxy Tab Pro 8.4 running KitKat and it works fine.  The only features that will not work under KitKat are ones requiring files on an SD card to be modified (embedded album art & lyrics, tag editing, and deleting files).

title: Doesn't work on kitkat at all

author: thomas Boyer
comment: This works most of the time. Sometimes the moto 360 will get the voice command correctly, but the music player will never play the command. Suggestions? Otherwise, great app.

reply.author: Hedami
reply.content: Version 1.6.5 eliminates a bug that prevented certain songs and artists from playing via voice command depending upon the case of the letters in the name. Also a new "Search [search term]" voice command has been added which will make playing songs from Android Wear much easier.

author: Joan Tilston
comment: I want the albums, artists etc in alphabetical order but the songs on each album as they come on the album. Can't do it, though. I don't call that good.

reply.author: Hedami
reply.content:
On the album song list screen, the default sort order is by track #, as defined in the music files' embedded tag data.  If the track # tag is undefined, then it probably would revert back to alphabetical sorting.

Also by tapping the bottom-right button on this screen, you can change the sort order (track # or alphabetical ascending/descending).

comment: It will be addictable if you add some themes...Other than that Great app...

reply.author: Hedami
reply.content: Theming is accomplished via customizable wallpaper and menu hues.  You can also customize the color of the home screen widgets.  You can access these customization options via the top-left icon on the right-side sliding panel.
